p:
Visual inspection of the co-visibility matrix reveals two fundamental features. First, CCCs are more prominent than CCSs when two or more individuals are featured in the same media article: 58% of individuals who have appeared in a media article with another individual are CCCs; considering co-visibility within select-30 media sources, this visibility advantage grows to 62%. Second, the strongest co-visibility (largest M
ij ) are within group rather than between group (see Supplementary Note 2 and Supplementary Fig. 6), reflecting the results of our content analysis.
